column5: Hey guys, So I got out onto lady Simcoe over my reading week, I took a break from the books and had some fun on the ice!! I have been doing real good on splake fishing at school but it felt nice to have something on the line that put up a fight Anyhow, we got 10 fish in total and lost numerous amount of fish mid fight   damn humpacks!!!! The key to this trip... the tactics that I would use for perch fishing... Shallow water was key for these buggers!!  well heres a look at the fish                Now its back up to school for some splake and smelt fishing...  Tight lines, Luc
Great report , nice fish !!
not really into ice fishing, but sweet largie in your avatar!!
Very nice!
Those are some impressive fish young fella!  Way to go!  Huge whities!
Awesome !!
Whities have been extremely shallow this year, blame the gobies!   Good shooting!
those are beauties for sure ..... looks like a great day of fishing ....
Whities have been extremely shallow this year, blame the gobies!   Good shooting! Yes they have been!! The whities we kept were full of gobies!!
Looks like a good outing Thanks for sharing Luc.
Wow. Nice fish.  Better than any day I've ever had ice fishing.
How deep did you find the whitey's at Luc ?
How deep did you find the whitey's at Luc ? 30 to 50 fow
Thats some real nice fish there dude.  If you get into the smelts,mind posting a pic of them. Would like to see the size your getting.
This is about the average size of the smelt as well as the splake!!
Nice.  I enjoy catching them, as I love eating them.
Thanks Luc, been fishing just over 50 fow, maybe time to come in a bit, nice fish, need me some, the wife has been trying to hook one but unsuccessful so far this year.  Maybe this weekend
Whities have been extremely shallow this year, blame the gobies!   Good shooting! i cant catch them in any less than 90 fow.....

i cant catch them in any less than 90 fow..... They are all over the place!! I just tried something new and got success! Ive never had much luck in deep water myself but have marked a ton of whities out in the 90 fow range. It comes down to a preference thing for sure

They are all over the place!! I just tried something new and got success! Ive never had much luck in deep water myself but have marked a ton of whities out in the 90 fow range. It comes down to a preference thing for sure Those shallow water fish are on the feed while those deep water fish are mostly not.  NICE CATCH AND GREAT REPORT ! ! !
i cant catch them in any less than 90 fow.....  When you think you're too shallow, go shallower
Impressive
When you think you're too shallow, go shallower Exactly!!

the best lure i use is a badboy tipped with a small black and silver tube,but i try lots...lakers i killed this year....i got a 20ish the other day in 25fow......they are moving in shallow following the baitfish.......got it on a chub sucker on a flag...yes they work!lol

the best lure i use is a badboy tipped with a small black and silver tube,but i try lots...lakers i killed this year....i got a 20ish the other day in 25fow......they are moving in shallow following the baitfish.......got it on a chub sucker on a flag...yes they work!lol Ive never had any success with the flags... that woulda been fun!!! I fish bad boys too, never seem to get anything on em. Lots of fish coming in to look at them though, just no takers
